verses.kjv: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah came this word from the LORD, saying,
verses.web: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came from LORD:
verses.ct: Early in the reign of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah, this message came from the LORD:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; Stand in the court of the LORD’s house, and speak unto all the cities of Judah, which come to worship in the LORD’s house, all the words that I command thee to speak unto them; diminish not a word:
verses.web: “LORD says: ‘Stand in the court of LORD’s house, and speak to all the cities of Judah, which come to worship in LORD’s house, all the words that I command you to speak to them. Don’t omit a word.
verses.ct: "The LORD says: 'Stand in the courtyard of the LORD's house and speak to the people from every city in Judah who come to worship there. Deliver every word I command you to say — don't leave out a single one.

verses.kjv: If so be they will hearken, and turn every man from his evil way, that I may repent me of the evil, which I purpose to do unto them because of the evil of their doings.
verses.web: It may be they will listen, and every man turn from his evil way; that I may relent from the evil which I intend to do to them because of the evil of their doings.’
verses.ct: Maybe they'll listen and each turn away from their evil ways. If they do, I'll relent from the disaster I'm planning to bring on them because of their wicked actions.'

verses.kjv: And thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the LORD; If ye will not hearken to me, to walk in my law, which I have set before you,
verses.web: You shall tell them, “LORD says: ‘If you will not listen to me, to walk in my law, which I have set before you,
verses.ct: Tell them, 'The LORD says: If you refuse to listen to me and follow my law that I've laid out for you —

verses.kjv: To hearken to the words of my servants the prophets, whom I sent unto you, both rising up early, and sending them, but ye have not hearkened;
verses.web: to listen to the words of my servants the prophets, whom I send to you, even rising up early and sending them, but you have not listened;
verses.ct: if you refuse to listen to my servants the prophets, whom I've sent to you again and again, though you've never listened —

verses.kjv: Then will I make this house like Shiloh, and will make this city a curse to all the nations of the earth.
verses.web: then I will make this house like Shiloh, and will make this city a curse to all the nations of the earth.” ’ ”
verses.ct: then I will destroy this house the way I destroyed Shiloh, and I will make this city a curse word among every nation on earth.'"

verses.kjv: So the priests and the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the house of the LORD.
verses.web: The priests and the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in LORD’s house.
verses.ct: The priests, the prophets, and all the people heard Jeremiah speak these words in the LORD's house.

verses.kjv: Now it came to pass, when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking all that the LORD had commanded him to speak unto all the people, that the priests and the prophets and all the people took him, saying, Thou shalt surely die.
verses.web: When Jeremiah had finished speaking all that LORD had commanded him to speak to all the people, the priests and the prophets and all the people seized him, saying, “You shall surely die!
verses.ct: When Jeremiah finished delivering everything the LORD had commanded him to say, the priests, the prophets, and all the people grabbed him and shouted, "You deserve to die!"

verses.kjv: Why hast thou prophesied in the name of the LORD, saying, This house shall be like Shiloh, and this city shall be desolate without an inhabitant? And all the people were gathered against Jeremiah in the house of the LORD.
verses.web: Why have you prophesied in LORD’s name, saying, ‘This house will be like Shiloh, and this city will be desolate, without inhabitant?’ ” All the people were crowded around Jeremiah in LORD’s house.
verses.ct: "How dare you prophesy in the LORD's name and say, 'This house will end up like Shiloh, and this city will be left empty and desolate, without a single person living in it'?" The whole crowd pressed in around Jeremiah inside the LORD's house.

verses.kjv: When the princes of Judah heard these things, then they came up from the king’s house unto the house of the LORD, and sat down in the entry of the new gate of the LORD’s house.
verses.web: When the princes of Judah heard these things, they came up from the king’s house to LORD’s house; and they sat in the entry of the new gate of LORD’s house.
verses.ct: When the officials of Judah heard what was happening, they rushed from the king's palace to the LORD's house and took their seats at the entrance of the New Gate.

verses.kjv: Then spake the priests and the prophets unto the princes and to all the people, saying, This man is worthy to die; for he hath prophesied against this city, as ye have heard with your ears.
verses.web: Then the priests and the prophets spoke to the princes and to all the people, saying, “This man is worthy of death; for he has prophesied against this city, as you have heard with your ears.”
verses.ct: The priests and prophets addressed the officials and the crowd: "This man deserves the death sentence! You heard him with your own ears — he prophesied against this city."

verses.kjv: Then spake Jeremiah unto all the princes and to all the people, saying, The LORD sent me to prophesy against this house and against this city all the words that ye have heard.
verses.web: Then Jeremiah spoke to all the princes and to all the people, saying, “LORD sent me to prophesy against this house and against this city all the words that you have heard.
verses.ct: Jeremiah spoke up to all the officials and the people: "The LORD himself sent me to prophesy against this house and this city — every word you just heard.

verses.kjv: Therefore now amend your ways and your doings, and obey the voice of the LORD your God; and the LORD will repent him of the evil that he hath pronounced against you.
verses.web: Now therefore amend your ways and your doings, and obey LORD your God’s voice; then LORD will relent from the evil that he has pronounced against you.
verses.ct: So change your ways and your actions right now, and obey the voice of the LORD your God. If you do, the LORD will relent from the disaster he has declared against you.

verses.kjv: As for me, behold, I am in your hand: do with me as seemeth good and meet unto you.
verses.web: But as for me, behold, I am in your hand. Do with me what is good and right in your eyes.
verses.ct: As for me — I'm in your hands. Do whatever you think is right.

verses.kjv: But know ye for certain, that if ye put me to death, ye shall surely bring innocent blood upon yourselves, and upon this city, and upon the inhabitants thereof: for of a truth the LORD hath sent me unto you to speak all these words in your ears.
verses.web: Only know for certain that, if you put me to death, you will bring innocent blood on yourselves, on this city, and on its inhabitants; for in truth LORD has sent me to you to speak all these words in your ears.”
verses.ct: But understand this clearly: if you put me to death, you will bring the guilt of innocent blood on yourselves, on this city, and on everyone who lives here. Because the LORD truly did send me to speak every one of these words to you."

verses.kjv: Then said the princes and all the people unto the priests and to the prophets; This man is not worthy to die: for he hath spoken to us in the name of the LORD our God.
verses.web: Then the princes and all the people said to the priests and to the prophets: “This man is not worthy of death; for he has spoken to us in the name of LORD our God.”
verses.ct: The officials and all the people turned to the priests and prophets and said, "This man doesn't deserve to die. He spoke to us in the name of the LORD our God."

verses.kjv: Then rose up certain of the elders of the land, and spake to all the assembly of the people, saying,
verses.web: Then certain of the elders of the land rose up, and spoke to all the assembly of the people, saying,
verses.ct: Then some of the elders of the land stood up and addressed the whole assembly:

verses.kjv: Micah the Morasthite prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and spake to all the people of Judah, saying, Thus saith the LORD of hosts; Zion shall be plowed like a field, and Jerusalem shall become heaps, and the mountain of the house as the high places of a forest.
verses.web: “Micah the Morashtite prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah; and he spoke to all the people of Judah, saying, ‘LORD of Armies says: “ ‘Zion will be plowed as a field, and Jerusalem will become heaps, and the mountain of the house as the high places of a forest.’
verses.ct: "Micah of Moresheth prophesied during the reign of King Hezekiah of Judah. He told all the people of Judah, 'The LORD of hosts says: Zion will be plowed like an open field, Jerusalem will be reduced to rubble, and the temple hill will be overgrown like a wooded ridge.'

verses.kjv: Did Hezekiah king of Judah and all Judah put him at all to death? did he not fear the LORD, and besought the LORD, and the LORD repented him of the evil which he had pronounced against them? Thus might we procure great evil against our souls.
verses.web: Did Hezekiah king of Judah and all Judah put him to death? Didn’t he fear LORD, and entreat the favor of LORD, and LORD relented of the disaster which he had pronounced against them? We would commit great evil against our own souls that way!”
verses.ct: Did King Hezekiah and the people of Judah execute him for that? No! Hezekiah feared the LORD and pleaded with him, and the LORD relented from the disaster he had declared against them. If we kill Jeremiah, we'll be bringing terrible evil on ourselves!"

verses.kjv: And there was also a man that prophesied in the name of the LORD, Urijah the son of Shemaiah of Kirjathjearim, who prophesied against this city and against this land according to all the words of Jeremiah:
verses.web: There was also a man who prophesied in LORD’s name, Uriah the son of Shemaiah of Kiriath Jearim; and he prophesied against this city and against this land according to all the words of Jeremiah.
verses.ct: Now there was another man who had prophesied in the LORD's name — Urijah son of Shemaiah from Kirjathjearim. He prophesied against this city and this land with the same message as Jeremiah.

verses.kjv: And when Jehoiakim the king, with all his mighty men, and all the princes, heard his words, the king sought to put him to death: but when Urijah heard it, he was afraid, and fled, and went into Egypt;
verses.web: When Jehoiakim the king, with all his mighty men and all the princes heard his words, the king sought to put him to death; but when Uriah heard it, he was afraid, and fled, and went into Egypt.
verses.ct: When King Jehoiakim, along with his warriors and officials, heard what Urijah was saying, the king wanted him dead. Urijah found out and fled to Egypt in fear.

verses.kjv: And Jehoiakim the king sent men into Egypt, namely, Elnathan the son of Achbor, and certain men with him into Egypt.
verses.web: Then Jehoiakim the king sent men into Egypt, Elnathan the son of Achbor, and certain men with him, into Egypt;
verses.ct: But King Jehoiakim sent men to Egypt — Elnathan son of Achbor and others with him —

verses.kjv: And they fetched forth Urijah out of Egypt, and brought him unto Jehoiakim the king; who slew him with the sword, and cast his dead body into the graves of the common people.
verses.web: and they fetched Uriah out of Egypt, and brought him to Jehoiakim the king, who killed him with the sword, and cast his dead body into the graves of the common people.
verses.ct: and they dragged Urijah back from Egypt and brought him before King Jehoiakim. The king had him killed with the sword and his body thrown into the common burial ground.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless the hand of Ahikam the son of Shaphan was with Jeremiah, that they should not give him into the hand of the people to put him to death.
verses.web: But the hand of Ahikam the son of Shaphan was with Jeremiah, so that they didn’t give him into the hand of the people to put him to death.
verses.ct: Jeremiah, however, was protected by Ahikam son of Shaphan, who made sure he wasn't handed over to the mob to be killed.
